titlestmt.titleproper: George W. Smith daybook and medical examination book 1875-1910
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: George W. Smith daybook and medical examination book
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: George W. Smith was the son of Judge Bartine Smith of Haverford, Pennsylvania. He was a medical doctor and a member of Crescent Lodge, No. 493. He practiced at 1809 N. 12th Street and 1302 Spruce Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. At the time of his death in 1910 he lived at 806 North Broad Street.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes. The daybook of patient accounts, 1875-1876, has entries which list the date, the patient's name, the prescription given, what the illness or symptoms were, and the charges made. It also includes a poem by Smith titled, "Our College Flag." The medical examination book includes materials from the late 1880s to 1910 and is indexed by name. The bulk of the volume lists the date, patient name, patient address, patient symptoms, and sometimes the medicine or treatment given. The back of the medical examination book includes various writings by Smith such as toasts, songs and club histories for the Oxford Club and Crescent Lodge #493 (some printed) and a valedictory address for the Hahnemanian Institute, as well as some poems written by J.G. Bryant.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
